FuncDef:
The nat port-limit enable command enables the user-based port number limit function.
The undo nat port-limit enable command disables the user-based port number limit function.
By default, the user-based port number limit function is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To prevent the number of connections to a CPE from exceeding the specified threshold, run the nat port-limit enable command to configure the user-based port number limit function.
Configuration Impact
After the nat port-limit enable command is run in the NAT instance view, the system limits the number of NAT ports to be allocated.
Precautions
The nat port-limit command takes effect only after the nat port-limit enable command is run to enable the NAT port number limit function.
This command does not take effect on the address-based NAT internal server.
This command cannot be run after the vsm on-board-mode enable command is run.
